p: To further determine that the VLPs produced in Pichia were empty and had not packaged cognate mRNA or any nonspecific yeast RNA, the peak fraction for each expression cassette was pelleted at 151,000 × g and resuspended in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) and 20 mM EDTA prior to analysis at absorbance wavelengths of 260 nm and 280 nm. The 260/280 nm ratios shown in Table 1 indicate that the level of nucleic acid present in the VLP samples was very low. This suggests that the VLPs produced in Pichia are reminiscent of ECs produced during mammalian cell infection, which contain no nucleic acid ( 35).
